discussion.content: CIDR prefix must be between 16 and 30
A VCN resides in a single Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region and covers a single, contiguous IPv4 CIDR block of your choice. The allowable VCN size range is /16 to /30. Example: 10.0. 0.0/16.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) virtual cloud network (VCN)? (Choose two.)

choices.A: A VCN can reside in multiple OCI regions and availability domains.
choices.D: A VCN creates the dynamic routing gateway by default.
choices.C: The allowable VCN size range is: /16 to /30.
choices.B: A VCN covers a single, contiguous IPv4 CIDR block of your choice.

questions.question_text: Which three actions need to be performed before attempting a data transfer service job?

comments.content: Transfer service is "offline data transfer solution" that doesn't use internet.

choices.E: Create an object bucket to receive the job.
choices.C: Data Transfer Service and Storage Service Limits should be checked and raised if required.
choices.A: Obtain an available host machine which can run the dts utility on-premises with SATA or USB drives attached for the transfer job.
choices.D: Set up SSH access to a host on OCI to coordinate the transfer job.
choices.B: Get access to a high-speed internet connection

discussion.content:
B
The A, or Address record, is one of the most commonly used record types. It allows you to map a domain name to an IP address. When adding an A record, the domain name is automatically appended to the name you enter. So, for example, if you want to make an A record for www.yourdomain.com, you would only need to add www for the name value. The yourdomain.com part is automatically assumed.
As per DNS Resource Record Types answer is B

questions.question_text: Which DNS resource record type is used to point a host name to an IPv4 address?

choices.D: You can deny access to a group via policies.
choices.A: You can use read, write, manage, and inspect as verbs for defining a policy.
choices.C: Users need not do anything but still have to be added to a group with appropriate policies defined.
choices.B: A policy is a document that specifies who can access which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure resources that your company has, and how.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about policies?

discussion.content: B, C is the correct answer

B, C is correct as per docum

Overview of Policies

A policy is a document that specifies who can access which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure resources that your company has, and how.

check this https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/data-safe/doc/iam-policies.html

About IAM Policies
A policy is a document that consists of one or more statements. A policy statement follows this basic syntax:

Allow group <group_name> to <verb><resource-type> in compartment <compartment_name>
Policy language uses simple verbs like inspect, read, use, and manage.

B,C are correct 
Write is not a verb .

comments.content: No, D is incorrect choice because everything is deny by default

discussion.content:
A. You can use read, write, manage, and inspect as verbs for defining a policy. -- X (write is no verb)
 D. You can deny access to a group via policies -- X (Default is deny, you have to provide allow)
B & C are correct Answer

There is no write verb so A is not the option. Policies only allow access and they cannot deny it. Instead there's an implicit deny, which means by default so D is not the option. 

B & C are the remaining 2 options that makes sense

comments.content: D cannot be as everything is denied by default.
After allowing a group, can't you chose to deny if there's a change in requirement?
Polices are used for giving access

I thought it was strange to mention a 'document' - but same word is used on Oracle 'A policy is a document that specifies who can access which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure resources that your company has"

discussion.content: Not sure a policy is a document as such, makes A and C the answers?
A & C is good check the link

comments.content: A, is wrong , you cannot use the write as a verb , the only options available for verb are : read, inspect,use and manage. the correct answer is B & C.

discussion.content: A and C is the correct answer
Once Oracle receives your data in the secure Oracle data transfer facility, we will upload it to your designated OCI Object Storage Bucket.

choices.A: An instance with enough storage to accommodate the job
